The first study describing the presence of HBoV in the stools of children with gastroenteritis has identified this virus as the only pathogen and therefore the only responsible for the pathology ( Vicente et al., 2007). Since then, three other species of HBoV have been described: HBoV2 ( Kapoor et al., 2009, Arthur et al., 2009), HBoV3 ( Arthur et al., 2009), and HBoV4. The genomic sequence of HBoV2 varies by 23% compared to that of HBoV, while that of HBoV3 varies from 18% compared to those of HBoV and HBoV2 ( Arthur et al., 2009).
